value.title: 5 Ways Self-Driving Cars Could Make Our World (And Our Lives) Better
value.excerpt: Progress towards more autonomous and self-driving cars is fast. Here we look at the benefits of self-driving cars and how they could make our lives and our world better.

value.title: Watch AI edit my skate video
value.excerpt: It's hard to know what to do with 360 footage, but maybe AI can fix that problem. I took the Insta360 One R to the skate park and let it edit my footage for me.

value.title: Here's what 'LOL' looks like in ancient Egyptian hieroglyphics
value.excerpt: A new Google machine learning tool shows that pictogram symbols of yore were pretty similar to emojis of today.

value.title: Alexa and Google Assistant execs on future trends for AI assistants
value.excerpt: Executives leading Alexa and Google Assistant teams say multimodal experiences and unsupervised learning are notable trends for AI assistants.

value.title: How valuable is your AI trust currency?
value.excerpt: Trustworthy AI depends on building trust in your people, processes, data, tools, and models, including mechanisms for building trust into your AI itself.

value.title: Google's Fabricius uses machine learning to decode hieroglyphs
value.excerpt: Google’s Arts and Culture vertical has been known to release fun apps and tools to help people engage with art and history. Now, the company is launching a web-based AI tool to let users interact with ancient Egyptian hieroglyphs and also help researchers decode the symbols with machine learning.

value.title: Amazon: AI can’t solve every conversational problem
value.excerpt: Amazon's Janet Slifka concedes that AI can't solve every problem. She spoke about the need for manual, human-driven solutions at VentureBeat Transform 2020.

value.title: How an AI graphic designer convinced clients it was human
value.excerpt: Art. Lebedev Studio has built an AI designer that creates original company logos. Sergey Kulinkovich, the company's art director, told TNW how it works.

value.title: Twitter CTO on machine learning challenges: ‘I’m not proud that we miss a lot of misinformation’
value.excerpt: Twitter is making big investments in machine learning to weed out manipulation on its platform. These efforts show the promise of ML as well as the limits.

value.title: Richard Socher: Natural language processing creates value in the enterprise

value.title: How Google addresses ML fairness and eliminates bias in conversational AI algorithms
value.excerpt: When it comes to algorithmic bias, how Google teaches Translate to recognize gender serves as an example of just how complex such a basic problem remains.

value.title: DARPA Pays $1 Million For An AI App That Can Predict An Enemy’s Emotions
value.excerpt: The science of using AI to detect and predict emotions is shaky but the U.S. military and a handful of well-funded startups are hoping to prove the doubters wrong, whatever the risks.

value.title: Japanese robot to clock in at a convenience store in test of retail automation
value.excerpt: In August, a robot vaguely resembling a kangaroo will begin stacking sandwiches, drinks and ready meals on shelves at a Japanese convenience store in a test its maker, Telexistence, hopes will help trigger a wave of retail automation.

value.title: Why Diversity In AI Is So Important
value.excerpt: The rapid expansion of artificial intelligence from facial recognition to self-driving cars is having a major impact on business and society, which is why we need more diversity among the people developing AI tools.

value.title: Deep Learning AI Needs Tools To Adapt To Changes In The Data Environment
value.excerpt: No market is stagnant while remaining relevant. How and when to update DL systems, as they are used in more and more places, is important. The ability to analyze the data sets is critical, both for initial feature engineering and as an ongoing process to keep the systems relevant and accurate.

value.title: Navistar Partners With TuSimple to Launch Self-Driving Trucks
value.excerpt: Navistar International Corporation NAV announced that it reached a partnership with TuSimple. The companies aim to develop SAE Level 4 self-driving trucks, whose production is targeted to start in 2024.

value.title: Translate Ancient Hieroglyphs With Google's New AI-Powered Tool
value.excerpt: Get started with a short course on the history of hieroglyphs, the writing system used by the ancient North African civilization. value.title: Deep Learning in the Media Supply Chain
value.excerpt: Deep Learning is a subset of machine learning and uses artificial neural networks that enable the system to learn autonomously. Deep Learning enables the processing of amounts of data that is not practical to process manually.

value.title: Shield AI Rejected A Pivot To ‘Selfie Drones.’ Now Its Drones Are Being Used By The Military Overseas
